qas.question: What is the limestone cap of the seamount made from?
During the ice age, what area of land was above water?
Has the seamount always been above sealevel?

answers.text: The top of the seamount has gone through periods of complete submergence

qas.question: What type of volcano forms the archipelago?
Why is the top of the seamount formed by marine organisms?

The submarine volcano was formed as part of the same proces as what two things?

answers.text: the floor of the Atlantic, and the Mid-Atlantic Ridge

qas.question: When was the caldera partially above sea level?
What is the volcano part of?
What did the Mid-Atlantic Ridge form?

context: The <b10_0>archipelago<b10_0/> is formed by high points on the rim of <b9_0>the caldera<b9_0/> of <a3_0>a submarine volcano<a3_0/> that forms a seamount.
